300-level live demo ); ![Dent Deletion banner](./images/cloud-native-integration-300-prep-banner.jpg) | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | Automate integration deployment using a cloud native approach to achieve greater productivity and simplified operations. Use an insurance quote aggregator scenario to demonstrate how the deployment of a complex integration solution can be automated using a pipeline. This demo also shows how container-based platforms enable operational consistency and automation across those capabilities, simplifying administration of an environment. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Integration | | **Demo capabilities** | Application Integration; Enterprise Messaging; API Management | | **Demo guidance** | This demo script has multiple tasks that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see.

This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **Demo downloads** | Automating deployment of multi-style integrations pptx | | **Required versions** | Cloud Pak for Integration | | **How to get support** | Contact #itz-techzone-support or techzone.help@ibm.com regarding issues with reserving and provisioning TechZone environments.

Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo use case. | ## **DEMO INSTALLATION AND SETUP**
1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Integration environment
Install Cloud Pak for Integration, or provision a ROKS environment. To reserve your ROKS instance, follow these steps:

1. To reserve a preinstalled Cloud Pak for Integration (CP4I) ROKS 4.6 cluster on Red Hat OpenShift, go here and complete the form. (If you do not have a sales opportunity, select the purpose **Practice / Self-Education** to create a two-week reservation.)

Select the "Schedule for later" option and leave the start date and time information unchanged.
NOTE If there are no clusters availabile in Express installation, go ahead with the Custom installation. While the process is the same, Express is a 5 minute request (because you will receive a pre-created ROKS cluster from a queue), and custom is a 2 hour provisioning (because the ROKS cluster will be installed, behind the scenes, from scratch for you).
2. You will receive a confirmation email confirming the instance is provisioning.

3. You will receive a second email once the environment is provisioned. This email contains information, such as URLs, allowing you to connect to the instance.
If you have issues connecting to your instance, please contact #itz-techzone-support.


4. In approximately thirty minutes, you will recieve an email confirming your ROKS environment is ready. You are now ready to install Cloud Pak for Integration.
**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Install Cloud Pak for Integration on ROKS cluster
1. Click here to install Cloud Pak for Integration, using your personal IBM credentials. Confirm that you are using the **ITZ** account.


2. Note that your deployment target and delivery method may be already selected. Ensure that the product version is 2021.4.1-0.


3. Scroll down the page to the **Select your cluster** section. From the list, select the Redhat Openshift Cluster that you just created.


4. Click **Add project**.


5. Enter **cp4i** as Project name. Click **Add**.


6. Scroll down to the **Set the deployment values** section and deselect the **Use an existing secret?** option to define a new password. Enter a value for csDefaultAdminPassword. It is important that you choose a password that is 32 characters in length and is composed of only letters and numbers. You will need this password in step 12.
NOTE: Currently password validation is not enforced on this page. If you proceed with an invalid password you will be able to start the installation but it will fail. There is no way to recover from this error other than provisioning a new cluster.

7. Scroll down to **Parameters with default values**. Click the collapsible section to open them. Change the default values parameters using the table below.
Warning: This demonstration’s 1-click installation occasionally fails. Due to issues with the current provisioning mechanism, we have alternate instructions to install the Cloud Pak for Integration product and complete preparation with the Demo Operator. Scroll to the bottom of this page for the Alternative install option: completing demo preparation with the Demo Operator section.
If you do have an SMTP email server and accounts that you can use, you may sign up for a free Mailtrap.io account. Mailtrap.io is a free cloud service that mimics an SMTP server. It is used for development/demonstration purposes only.
| FIELD | ACTION | | ------ | ------- | | **demoPreparation:** | Set to ‘true’ | | **demoAPICEmailAddress:** | If you’re using mailtrap.io, use any email address. Use ’apicadmin@example.com’ to be safe — example.com is guaranteed to not be a real domain. If you’re using your own mail server, use an email address that you can receive and read. | | **demoAPICMailServerPort:** | If you’re using mailtrap, leave this as 2525. | | **demoAPICMialServerUsername:** | Set this to your mailtrap username. | | **demoAPICMailServerPassword:** | Set this to your mailtrap password. |

8. Accept the license agreement and click **Install** to install Cloud Pak for Integration. The installation will take up to 90 minutes.


9. You can view the progress in the Schematics progress bar or check the details in view log.


10. When the status is **Active**, you will be able to access Cloud Pak for Integration Platform Navigator. Select **Offering Dashboard** on the upper right corner of the page.


11. On the log in page, select the authentication type **IBM provided credentials (admin only)**.


12. Log in using the admin userid and password you created in step 6.


13. Click **Integration instances**.


14. The parts of the Cloud Pak (API Connect, App Connect Designer, App Connect Dashboard and Asset Repository) will display here. Additional instances for any of the integration capabilities can be created by selecting **Create capability**.


You have successfully completed cluster provisioning, installation of Cloud Pak for Integration, and deployment of API Connect and App Connect. You are ready to proceed.
**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Fork the GitHub repository
This demo uses a Tekton pipeline to build images and deploy them for four App Connect integration servers and one MQ server. Now we fork a GitHub repository with all necessary assets for the demo, including the script to create the pipeline.
1. Open a browser and navigate here.

2. If necessary, log in with your personal GitHub account.
3. Click **Fork**. 


4. Select the organization where you want to fork. 

5. The **cp4i-deployment-samples** folder was forked to your organization. You will need its URL in section 5 of this preparation.


**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Clone the GitHub repository to your machine
NOTE: To copy the repo you will need to have the Git CLI on your machine. If you don’t have it, follow the installation steps described in this page, based in your operational system.
1. On the forked repo, click **Code** (1) and click **Copy URL button** (2) on the **Clone HTTPS** section.


2. Open your terminal window and execute this command:
``` git clone ```
3. Open the cp4i-deployment-samples folder with this command:
``` cd cp4i-deployment-samples ```
4. You should now see a folder and multiple files. To be able to execute our script files, change the file permission with this command:
``` chmod 755 * ```
**[Go to top](#top)**
5 - Access your ROKS cluster and install the command line tool
In this section, you access your ROKS cluster and install the OpenShift command line tool. If you already have the command line tool, you can proceed to **6 - Access your ROKS cluster using CLI**.
1. Open My reservations in **IBM Technology Zone**.
2. Select your **CP4I ROKS** cluster.


3. Click **Open your Managed OpenShift (ROKS) environment**.


4. Click **OpenShift web console**.


5. On the web console page, click **?** (1), and select **Command line tools** (2). 


6. Follow the links to install the **OpenShift Command Line Interface** (CLI) for your Operational System. 


**[Go to top](#top)**
6 - Access your ROKS cluster using CLI
1. Log in OpenShift cluster using CLI. From the dropdown menu in the upper right of the page, under your **username** (1), click **Copy login command** (2).


2. Click **Display Token**.


3. Copy the **login** command.


4. Open your terminal window and paste the **login command** to access your OpenShift cluster.



**[Go to top](#top)**
7 - Set up the parameters to install the pipeline
We’re now going to set up pipeline triggers by linking the GitHub repository to OpenShift pipelines. Now, when you commit a change to GitHub, your OpenShift pipeline runs automatically.
1. Set the namespace to be the correct namespace. It should be **cp4i**. On your terminal window, run this command:
``` export NAMESPACE=cp4i ```
2. Set the GitHub branch to **main** so the script knows which version of the GitHub artifacts to use.
``` export BRANCH=main ```
3. Set the GitHub repository to use as the URL of your forked repository (made in section 1). You can see it in your browser address bar.


For example, ours is: https://github.com/rosorio/cp4i-deployment-samples.git. Note that rosorio is our github id, yours will be different.
``` export FORKED_REPO=https://github.com//cp4i-deployment-samples.git ```


**[Go to top](#top)**
8 - Create the pipeline
Follow these steps to create the pipeline in OpenShift pipeline page. 
1. In the **cp4i-deployment-samples** folder, open the **DrivewayDentDeletion/Operators folder**.
``` cd DrivewayDentDeletion/Operators ```

2. Create the pipeline by running this command.
``` ./cicd-apply-test-apic-pipeline.sh -n $NAMESPACE -r $FORKED_REPO -b $BRANCH ```

3. Return to the OpenShift console. On the left menu, open **Pipelines**, then **Pipelines** to see what has been added.

4. On the **Project combo box** (1), select **cp4i** (2).

5. There should be two pipelines.

**[Go to top](#top)**
9 - Download the BAR file
In this section, you download a BAR (broker archive) file to be used during the demo. 
1. Open this URL in your browser: https://github.com/amarIBM/hello-world/blob/master/HttpEchoApp.bar
2. Click the **Download** button. 


Great! You are ready to present the demo.
**[Go to top](#top)**

NOTE: To complete installation using the Demo Operator, open the collapsible section below.
Alternative install option: completing demo preparation with the Demo Operator
NOTE: There are a number of advantages to using the Demo Operator:

• You can choose to install only the demos you plan to use, which will reduce the install time and simplify your environment.

• Should any errors occur, you can simply delete the demo custom resource that you have created and try creating it again, perhaps with a reduced number of demos to install. Comparatively, if demoPreparation is set to true and that installation fails, you may have to start from scratch, reprovisioning the cluster.

• You can use this Demo operator on any Cloud Pak for Integration installation, so you are not tied to the ROKS infrastructure as you are with the current approach. You could, for example, use a locally installed environment.

Please note that use of the Demo Operator requires experience with creating custom resources in OpenShift. If you do not have the required skillset to use Demo Operator, please complete the install instructions in section 2 above. Should this fail,please raise a ticket via the IBM Support Portal for help.
Ensure that you have completed steps 1-6 in the **2 - Install Cloud Pak for Integration on ROKS cluster** section above.
1. Scroll down to **Parameters with default values**. Click the collapsible section to open them. Change the default values parameters using the table below.
If you do have an SMTP email server and accounts that you can use, you may sign up for a free Mailtrap.io account. Mailtrap is a free cloud service that mimics an SMTP server. It is used for development/demonstration purposes only.
| FIELD | ACTION | | ------ | ------- | | **demoPreparation:** | Set to false | | **demoAPICEmailAddress:** | If you’re using mailtrap.io, use any email address. Use ’apicadmin@example.com’ to be safe — example.com is guaranteed to not be a real domain. If you’re using your own mail server, use an email address that you can receive and read. | | **demoAPICMailServerPort:** | If you’re using mailtrap, leave this as 2525. | | **demoAPICMialServerUsername:** | Set this to your mailtrap username. | | **demoAPICMailServerPassword:** | Set this to your mailtrap password. |

2. Once this step is complete, go here to complete the demo preparation using the Demo Operator. Refer to the **Driveway Dent Deletion** details.
**[Go to top](#top)**
Click [here](/300-integration-cloud-native-integration/demo-script) to go to the **Demo script** on the next tab. (actual PDF to be produced when demo and script are approved)
